docs.lead_paragraph: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, pleaded with insurance companies on Wednesday to scrap their campaign against President Obama's health care bill and to work with the White House to pass it.

headline.main: Sebelius to Insurers: It's Not Too Late to Work Together

docs.abstract: How long "before the business model collapses of its own weight?'' the secretary of health and human services asked insurers on Wednesday.
docs.snippet: How long "before the business model collapses of its own weight?'' the secretary of health and human services asked insurers on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ezra Klein has been getting some grief for two almost back-to-back blog posts: In the first one, he tried to persuade skeptical progressives that the health care bill "represents an enormous leftward shift for American social policy," only to turn around in the second post and suggest that conservatives are "insane" for freaking out about such a perfectly moderate, not-at-all left-wing piece of legislation. Trying to resolve the apparent contradiction, he writes:

headline.main: The Rockefeller Republican Health Care Bill

docs.abstract: Is the current health care legislation really a "moderate Republican" proposal?
docs.snippet: Is the current health care legislation really a "moderate Republican" proposal?

docs.lead_paragraph: How many people die because they lack health insurance has been a matter of debate recently.
docs.abstract: Different studies offer differ answers. A Harvard doctor tries to sort through the research.
docs.snippet: Different studies offer differ answers. A Harvard doctor tries to sort through the research.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Democrats considered potential maneuvers, business groups announced plans for a campaign to stop the legislation.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Dan Lipinski, Democrat of Illinois, warned party leaders on Tuesday that he would vote against major health care legislation if it does not include tight restrictions on the use of federal money for insurance coverage of abortions.

headline.main: Another House Democrat Demands Abortion Restrictions

docs.abstract: Representative Dan Lipinski, Democrat of Illinois, threatens to vote against health care legislation without tighter restrictions on federal funding for abortion.
docs.snippet: Representative Dan Lipinski, Democrat of Illinois, threatens to vote against health care legislation without tighter restrictions on federal funding for abortion.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats are using examples of soaring health insurance premiums to link Republicans to the problem side of the health care equation.

headline.main: In Ad, Democrats Cite G.O.P. Indifference to High Health Costs

docs.abstract: The Democrats find a punching bag in Mitt Romney, a likely Republican candidate for president in 2012, in an effort to stir anger over insurance premium increases.
docs.snippet: The Democrats find a punching bag in Mitt Romney, a likely Republican candidate for president in 2012, in an effort to stir anger over insurance premium increases.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's protest season again in Washington.
docs.abstract: Protesters leave a message for insurers and Congress in the asphalt, but they won't have the last word just yet.

docs.lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton.

headline.main: Reader Response: Fraud and Abuse in U.S. Health Care

docs.abstract: An economist responds to readers' comments and questions about his post on how frequently medical service providers try to defraud the government.
